project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11416].
  {panel}

h4. Summary:
On the *Work mode* (Scrum board), If the first (top) swim lane is unfolded/expanded, the display is correct.
However, if user folds in the top swim lane, none of the Issue keys in any of the swim lanes below are displayed: they are shown as a hyperlink with 3 dots "..."

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Go to *JIRA Agile work mode* that has more than 1 swimlane
# Fold in the first swimlane
# Unfold/expand the other swimlanes
# The issue key will not be displayed. It will show *...* (triple dots) instead

h4. Additional Information
- Occurs in JIRA 6.3.6 with JIRA Agile 6.6.11, JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.11
- This does not occur in JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.0
- I changed the priority to *Major* due to the fact that it doesn't render *ISSUE KEY* properly.
fields.summary: Issue Keys are not rendered properly on Scrum work mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, the Velocity Chart's *Completed* column only includes estimations from completed stories. By definition, the velocity is the measure of work done on a given interval/sprint. The measure would be more accurate if it includes stories that were also *worked on but not completed*. (stories that were part of the sprint but not moved to the Done column)
fields.summary: Velocity Chart should include amount of work done on incomplete stories in Completed column

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have just installed JIRA Agile 6.6.11 (out today :-)). But I think I have already found a bug.

On an Agile Scrum board, in work mode I have swim lanes set to stories.
If the first (top) swim lane is unfolded, the display is correct.
However, if I fold in the top swim lane, none of the Issue keys in any of the swim lanes below are displayed: they are shown as a hyperlink with 3 dots "..."
fields.summary: Issuekey displayed as "..." on workboard when first swimlane folded in

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At an attempt to open Issue Details for issues with attachments of file types that use zip structure (e.g. *.zip, .frt, .xlsx, .gliffy, pptx, .docx*), JIRA Agile throws errors:
{quote}java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/jira/issue/attachment/AttachmentZipKit$FileCriteria{quote}
----
*Workaround 1*
Open the issues in a separate tab in the JIRA Issue View, and perform any operations there. Refresh the board to view changes.

*Workaround 2*
# As an admin or sysadmin, go to *JIRA Administration > System > Attachment Settings*.
# Click *Edit Settings*.
# Switch the _Enable ZIP Support_ option to "Off" and save the settings.
_Note:_ this will only disable the option to download all attachments as a single .zip file, and will not affect the availability of existing files (including .zip ones).

If you follow the second workaround, you'll want to re-enable the ZIP support setting once the fix is rolled out.

----

{panel}If you see Issue Keys on the board displayed as ellipsis ('...'), you're running into a different bug in Agile, GHS-11424.{panel}
fields.summary: Errors when opening Issue Details pane for issues with attachments

We have quick filters set and use them for plan and work mode views frequently however it really trips me up when i switch between the views and the filter changes. To me, filters should persist above views.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to create a new board, the user may be unable to retrieve the shared filter depending upon where it is returned in the search results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create the following saved filters:
{noformat}
Cash Management - A
Cash Management - B
Cash Management - C
Cash Management - D
Cash Management - E
Cash Management - F
Cash Management - G
Cash Management - H
Cash Management - I
Cash Management - J
Cash Management - K
Cash Management - L
Cash Management - M
Cash Management - N
Cash Management - O
Cash Management - P
Cash Management - Q
Cash Management - R
Cash Management - S
Cash Management - T
Cash Management - U
Cash Management - V
Cash Management - W
Cash Management - X
Cash Management - Y
Cash Management - Z
Man ABC
Man Man
Man_Man
{noformat}
# Create a new JIRA Agile board from an existing Saved Filter.
# Attempt to enter "Man Man" or "Man_Man".

h3. Expected Results

The filters are returned.

h3. Actual Results

The filters are not returned.

h3. Notes

It appears that there is a limitation in the number of results that the drop-down can return, and if the filter is returned after those results it does not appear. If all the 'Cash Management' filters do not exist, 'Man_Man' and 'Man Man' will appear.

h3. Workaround

Rename the filter something else temporarily, such as A Man ABC, and then use that as it will appear at the top of the list.
fields.summary: Unable to Find Shared Saved Filter when creating a New Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: For Kanban boards, there is no Plan mode, so the automatic ranking of newly created features (GHS-6905) should apply to issues selected on the left-most column instead.
fields.summary: Ranking a new issue directly underneath the currently selected issue doesn't work on Kanban boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the "Send to Top" and "Send to Bottom" ranking features are not visible on Kanban boards because the "right click" context menu does not show these commands in Work mode (and Kanban boards have no Plan mode).

There is a workaround by using shortcut keys; e.g., pressing "s" and "t" will rank the selected issues to the top of the current column, but that workaround is hard to discover.
fields.summary: "Send to top" should be available via the UI on Kanban boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1) Can we please have a simple burndown chart that displays just 1 line, which is story points remaining for the release – the X-Axis should Iterations and the Y-Axis should be Points (we usually don’t need our charts at a daily level (iteration level is more than enough), although perhaps you would want to allow the user to select iteration or daily burndown options?)

2) Can we have a simple chart or dashboard to show  Cycle times per iteration,  ideally this would be broken down to T-Shirt size e.g. Extra Small, 1.3 days average, Small 2.4 days, Medium 3 days, Large 4.7 days, Extra Large 8.1 days

I've also updated the Burn-up chart idea https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5513 as this seems an essential part of any serious Agile tool, and your product is currently missing this basic feature!
fields.summary: Improve Agile charts - Burndown and Cycle Times

{panel}
When using a Scrum Board, The Progress Bar is being shrunk 1/10 the size of the card in both Firefox 33.0.2 and Internet Explorer 9, also using latest version of Chrome (JIRA Software 7.3.6)
h3. Steps To Reproduce

 - Configure the board to add Progress, Original Estimate, and Due Date

Progress bar should extend across the entire card - see screenshot:

!chrome.png|thumbnail!

Progress Bar is a fraction the size of the card - see screenshot: 

!firefox.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Scrum Board Incorrectly Displays Progress Bar

fields.description:
As a Certified Scrum Product Owner, I want a separate Acceptance Criteria field added to the list of Issue fields available for use so that I can write and format my acceptance criteria separately from the story description.

Several of the Agile training companies out there, such as Solutions IQ, advocate that User Stories contain an area for Acceptance Criteria.  The Product Owner is responsible for listing this criteria so the developers have a better understanding of how a feature might look and behave with user interaction.  Having the Acceptance Criteria also improves the grooming of the stories so the team's velocity is more accurate.

I had Acceptance Criteria as a separate field in Microsoft TFS and Version One.  I can enter all that information into the Description field but then everyone has to scroll to read every piece of detail about the story and acceptance criteria.  Also, many teams like to export some data fields from there Agile tool to create a large scale sprint wall to impress the executives.
fields.summary: Acceptance Criteria Field

fields.description:
One of the advantages of Kanban is to make your process visual and explicit. One part of it is to add your "Definition of done" at the bottom of every column. This is a short description of the conditions under which this step of the process can be considered complete. See an example here: http://technitai.wordpress.com/tag/game-design/

The idea would be to let board managers add a short check list of those steps that would be displayed at the bottom of each column.
fields.summary: Definition of Done on Kanban boards / Making Process Policies Explicit

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello,
In Kanban, you can use the boards throughput to estimate future projects based on future data. The throughput is measured in issues/day.

For instance, if you know that your team has an average throughput of 0.5 issues/day and you have 10 issues to deal with, you can make a good estimation by saying that it would take 10 * 0.5 = 20 days. For a better estimation, you can also consider your bug/feature ration (the average number of bugs you introduce for every new feature). So if you have bug/feature ratio of 0.4 and you have 10 features to add, you should in fact count 14 issues.

So the feature would be the following:
* On the Kanban board report's, dislay the current values and the historic for the rolling average throughput, a bit like in the current control flow chart for Kanban boards. The throughput should be calculated based on the time it takes for an issue to cross the board, like cycle time.
* Also display somewhere the bug/feature ratio on the same page.

Before moving to Jira we were calculating the throughput based on our post-it notes and it proved to be a very valuable tool. I am missing this in Jira.

Let me know if you have any question.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Display Kanban boards throughput in report mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11381].
  {panel}

When viewing the Release Burndown chart, if an issue has the fixVersion value updated, the report shows it as an unestimated issue. It follows below the steps to reproduce this behaviour:

1 - create a Scrum project and add a version (V1 for example)
2 - create some stories, set an Original Estimate and set fixVersion to V1
3 - create a sprint and add the stories created on step 2 to this sprint 
4 - go to the Release Burndown report. It will show the total estimate and “0% of unestimated issues” message, just like in release_burndown_original.png
5 - open one of the stories and remove V1 from the fixVersion field
6 - go back to Release Burndown report. It will show “X% of issues do not have an estimate (1 of Y)”, just like in release_burndown_updated.png

!release_burndown_original.png!
!release_burndown_updated.png!

fields.description:
Currently the {{Release...}} button on the Kanban board cannot be used to also trigger a build on a Bamboo server. 

The workaround is to:
1) Create a release using the "Release..." link from the Kanban board (to set the fix version for all issues in the Done column)
2) From the "Manage Versions" screen in the project, "Unrelease" the release that was just created
3) From the "Manage Versions" screen "Build & Release" the same version in order to get Bamboo to build and link to the release

As we can see from above, using the Kanban board's Release button is great for adding fix versions to all those issues automatically, but the process feels disconnected because you cant get it to trigger a Bamboo build as well. 

The bottom line is for *the Kanban's {{release}} function to work the same way as JIRA project's {{Build and Release}} function.*
fields.summary: Trigger a Bamboo build directly from the Kanban board

fields.description:
h3.Symptom
Some of the custom fields are not available in the 'Card Layout' configuration of boards.

h3.Diagnosis
This happens when the Applicable Contexts for the custom field is not Global ('All Issue Types').

h3.Solution
Check the application context for the custom field as follows:
# Browse to JIRA _Administration > System > Custom Fields_.
# For the specific custom field, click on the Cog icon and select 'Configure'.
# Under the 'Default Configuration Scheme' section, click on 'Edit Configuration' for the Application Contexts.
# From the section 'Choose applicable issue types', for 'Issue Types', select the value 'Any issue type'.
# Press 'Modify' to save the configuration.
fields.summary: Custom fields not visible in JIRA Agile card layout for Agile Boards

fields.description:
Description:
If resolving an issue with 0 remaining time set, the previously contained remaining is still retained in a different variable. This one is shown in e.g. swim lanes.

Reproduce:
1. Create a subtask on a story. Estimate 4h.
2. Put it in progress.
3. Drag it to resolved.
4. Log 1m and set remaining to 0
5. Verify that the remaining is set to 0m in the right (issue details pane).
6. Verify that the remaining time shown in the resolved lane is 3h 59m or 4h.
fields.summary: Resolving a subtask doesn't update remaining time shown in resolved/closed lane

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

If there are any custom statuses in the board's project, then whenever a new board is created for that project, the status will automatically be mapped to a column according to its category.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new status in JIRA (for example, 'TEST 1') and put it in the workflow of the project connected to the board
!status1.png|thumbnail!
# Head over to the board, and check the columns. The new status should still be Unmapped. Notice the color of the status lozenge
!status2.png|thumbnail!
# Create a new board based on the same project, and check the new status ('TEST 1'). It is automatically mapped to the column of 'In Progress' based on the color of the status lozenge
!status3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

This was tested in JIRA Agile 6.6.0
fields.summary: Statuses are automatically mapped to board Columns according to status category

fields.description:
h4. Summary
There's a couple of support cases where exceptions are being raised by the LexoRankBalancingService. Here's a tidbit of the exceptions being raised:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankIntegrityException: Expected the first rank row to be of type MINIMUM_MARKER_ROW. Found row[LexoRankRow{id=464416, fieldId=11474, issueId=253307, lockHash='null', lockTime=null, rank='0|10000g:', type=ISSUE_RANK_ROW}]
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.getMinimumMarkerRowAndNextRow(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:393)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalanceOperation.moveMarkerRowToNextBucket(LexoRankBalanceOperation.java:318)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalanceOperation.execute(LexoRankBalanceOperation.java:103)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.balanceFieldId(LexoRankBalancer.java:170)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.balanceFieldIds(LexoRankBalancer.java:92)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankScheduledBalanceHandler.run(LexoRankScheduledBalanceHandler.java:48)
{noformat}

Here's another:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankIntegrityException: Expected the first rank row to be of type MAXIMUM_MARKER_ROW. Found row[LexoRankRow
{id=748, fieldId=10200, issueId=11196, lockHash='null', lockTime=null, rank='0|zzzzzz:i', type=ISSUE_RANK_ROW}
]
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.getMaximumMarkerRowAndPreviousRow(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:418)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially(LexoRankOperation.java:169)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.execute(LexoRankOperation.java:111)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankService.performRankOperation(LexoRankService.java:239)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankService.getRankOrRankInitially(LexoRankService.java:130)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType.getValueFromIssue(LexoRankCFType.java:122)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType.getValueFromIssue(LexoRankCFType.java:30)
{noformat}

h4. Cause
Somehow, on these instances, an issue was given a value for its rank that occurred outside the minimum- and maxiumum-marker row's values.

Here's an example of the breached values:

|| FIELD_ID || ID || ISSUE_ID || LOCK_HASH || LOCK_TIME || RANK || TYPE ||
| 10200 | 748 | 11196 |  |  | 0\|zzzzzz:i | 1 |
| 10200 | 3 | 9223372036854775807 |  |  | 0\|zzzzzz: | 2 |
| 10200 | 704 | 11152 |  |  | 0\|zzzzzv: | 1 |
| 10200 | 747 | 11195 |  |  | 0\|zzzzzs: | 1 |
| 10200 | 745 | 11193 |  |  | 0\|zzzzzc: | 1 |
| 10200 | 744 | 11192 |  |  | 0\|zzzzz4: | 1 |
| 10200 | 743 | 11191 |  |  | 0\|zzzzyw: | 1 |
| 10200 | 740 | 11188 |  |  | 0\|zzzzyg: | 1 |
| 10200 | 739 | 11187 |  |  | 0\|zzzzy8: | 1 |
| 10200 | 738 | 11186 |  |  | 0\|zzzzy0: | 1 |

I'm not sure how the rank of {{0|zzzzzz:i}} was set, but it causes problems: The LexoRankBalanceOperation expects the MAXIMUM_ or MINIMUM_MARKER_ROW to be the first row returned in a SQL query where the rows are ordered by RANK. If any value appears before the marker row in their respective queries, integrity exceptions will be raised upon most LexoRank operations.

Since LexoRank operations occur when issues are deleted, these integrity exceptions actively prevent issues from being deleted.

The integrity violation also prevents a re-balancing from occurring, so attempts to heal the rankings probably won't work, either.

h4. Workaround

You can manually edit the rank values in the LEXORANK ActiveObjects table.

# Get all the values in the lexorank table: {code:sql}SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" ORDER BY "RANK" DESC;{code}
# Determine the # of rows that appear above the maximum value (i.e., the row of type='2'). In the above example, there is just one: \\ {noformat}| 10200 | 748 | 11196 |  |  | 0|zzzzzz:i | 1 |{noformat}
# Determine the rank value of the maximum value. In the above example, it is {{0|zzzzzz:}}
# Determine the highest rank value below the maximum. In the above example, it is {{0|zzzzzv:}}
# Determine the possible values between the maximum value and the value you found in step 3.\\ In our example, the values are {{0|zzzzzz:}} and {{0|zzzzzv:}}, respectively. \\ The possible values between here are {{0|zzzzzw:}}, {{0|zzzzzx:}} and {{0|zzzzzy:}}.
# For each issue above the maximum value, update the row to use one of the values determined in step 4. {code:sql}UPDATE "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" SET "RANK"=<that value> WHERE "ID"=<the row's id>;{code}
Do the same for any rows that fall below the minimum value: {code:sql}SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" ORDER BY "RANK" ASC;{code}
# Once all of that is done, trigger a LexoRankBalanceOperation to occur. You can do this by issuing a GET request to {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/lexorank/balance}} with an admin's credentials.
fields.summary: LexoRank integrity is breached by values set outside the markers

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Sunday I finished a 2 week sprint scheduled to end either Sunday or early Monday morning. I then planned a new sprint and started it. After this point, going to Agile board does not render the board or any tasks. The plan, work, and report tabs are not present. At the bottom of the page is a red error which I expand and see the message I've included below.

My issues still exist and the dashboard does display information on the sprint using card board widgets, but the slick display, report, planning DRAGON DROP (or drag and drop if you're boring), and work mechanisms are inactive. I've run two successful sprints using this and do not have a large quantity of issues or work. I only have a single user (myself) interacting with things as this is a system I use to track personal development work on a side project.

This happens every time for me with the environment in this current state. I can conceivably work like this for the next two weeks since I can update the issues if I need to using the card board classic widget from the dashboard, but I'll not be able to use this to plan my next sprint and would appreciate a resolution or workaround by that time.

Error message below:

Details
1.◦Exception: 'JPT' is undefined
◦Resource: http://65.24.220.140:8080/s/8aa38849e5983d1739aed4ff305ed9bb-T/en_USbd1pxo/6336/10/b33ca41078b16db31a113e1a9c2767dd/_/download/contextbatch/js/atl.general,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget/batch.js?locale=en-US&isAdmin=true
◦Line: 167

2.◦Exception: Object doesn't support this action
◦Resource: http://65.24.220.140:8080/s/8aa38849e5983d1739aed4ff305ed9bb-T/en_USbd1pxo/6336/10/b33ca41078b16db31a113e1a9c2767dd/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-atl.general/batch.js?locale=en-US&isAdmin=true

fields.description:
I've noticed that viewing an Agile Wallboard Gadget that makes use of a board's quick filter(s) can impact the appearance of the actual Agile board referenced by the gadget when you switch over to it.  When you switch from the dashboard to the Agile board, the URL will use the filter settings that were applied to the gadget on the dashboard, BUT the corresponding filters do not have the visual cue that they are being applied.  This results in an inverted behavior for those filter buttons (i.e. turning the filter 'on' actually turns it 'off').

So the problem is two-fold.  First, the gadget's filter settings replace any user stored filter settings - a very minor inconvenience. Second, the behavior of those filters becomes inverted, which can be rather confusing for users.

The steps to reproduce this bug are:
1. Create an Agile board with some quick filters and create a dashboard that uses the Agile Wallboard Gadget, which is configured to apply at least one of those quick filters.
2. View the dashboard.
3. View the Agile board.
4. Compare the applied quick filters in the URL to which ones are applied visually in the UI.

This bug does not seem to occur 100% of the time, but does seem to occur the majority of the time.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget filter settings replace/invert Agile board filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA Agile assumes that the statuses in the left-most column equate to Not Started and the statuses in the right-most column equate to Done. A more flexible implementation would allow us to use checkboxes when configuring our boards to indicate which column(s) are Not Started columns and which column(s) are Done columns.

For example, we use a four-step workflow for stories (Not Started->In Progress->In Review->Done). We also have the additional states of Blocked and Dropped which can be transitioned to from any state.

I'd like to set my Scrum Board up with six columns in this order (Not Started, In Progress, In Review, Done, Blocked, Dropped). But Done and Dropped need to share the last column--otherwise we have problems closing Sprints with a mixture of done and dropped stories or sub-tasks. When Done and Dropped share the last column, there is no visual indication the story (or task) is Done or Dropped unless the details of the story (or task) are inspected. Even worse, we had to allow transition of stories to Done from any state to match the transition to Dropped from any state. Otherwise, a user might attempt to drag a story from In Progress to Done (skipping In Review) and JIRA Agile would silently put it in Dropped state (since there is no legal transition from In Progress to Done).

On the left-side of the board, if I put Blocked to the left of Not Started, JIRA Agile counts my Not Started stories as In Progress when looking at the story point accumulation, which is incorrect.
fields.summary: As the configurer of an agile board, I want to indicate which columns are "Not Started" columns and which columns are "Done" columns

fields.description:
There is no convenient way to select a single issue on the plan view without opening the detail view. This is a regression from previous versions.

The Release Notes state:
{quote}
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.5+Release+Notes
Clicking a card automatically opens the issue detail view — Previously, clicking a card would select it, but not open the issue detail view. You can still select a card without opening the issue view by using cmd/shift-click.
{quote}

However, ctrl-click will add the clicked row to your selection, and shift-click will add the rows between your current selection and the clicked row to the selection. 

The only workflow that allows the user to click on a row, manipulate it, then click on another row, and not open the detail view (e.g. for the purposes of ranking) is to right click on a row, then left click on the same row.

As a user, I want to be able to click on a row in plan mode on my agile board without opening the detail pane so that I can maximize screen real estate and avoid losing my place in the list as it re-sizes to accommodate the detail view.
fields.summary: Cannot select a single issue in Plan mode without opening Details pane

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11345].
  {panel}

The current Behaviour of a Scrum Sprint JIRA Agile for Closed ticket right now is:
* when a ticket included in a future sprint and get closed before the sprint is started, it would be still included when the Sprint Master started the sprint then it shows up in the Plan Mode.
* if a ticket is closed while a sprint is currently running, the issue key of the ticket will be having a strike through and the ticket still shown in the Plan Mode, including the closed ticket above.

Actually, there is no need to include a ticket that have been closed to a future sprint as it does not need to be worked anymore and the Sprint Master should know about it. But, since the issue will be gone in the Plan Mode if it is closed before Sprint is started, it could be hard to know that there is actually a closed ticket in the sprint. Hence, a notification or a simple behaviour to handle the closed ticket in a future sprint could be useful like:
* A warning notification that will be pop-up before starting a sprint telling that a closed ticket is inside.
* the closed ticket is removed from the sprint and the backlog.
* to still shows closed ticket same as the behaviour of a closed ticket in a running sprint.
fields.summary: Improve How JIRA Agile Handle Closed Ticket in a Future Sprint

With the current Agile setup it is easy to make mistakes regarding the visibility of boards. Once the base for the board is a filter that is shared with anyone, even people that don't have access to a project get to know that there's a board "Customer XY Kanban Board" or such.

I understand that filters can span more than one project, so my suggestion would be that the user is guided with hints (or sensible defaults).
* When creating a new board from a saved filter (visible for everyone) that contains "project = X" as restriction there should be a hint that the recommended share level is with project only. I would be OK with Jira changing the visibility of the filter to project only after a popup asking for agreement.
* When changing the filter for an existing board the same recommendations should occur.

Alternatively:
Maybe Agile should get a full-featured permission management where (independently of filter) the visibility and other permissions can be configured.

fields.description:
Ticket for documentation to be updated.

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
* create a Scrum board with some issues
* create a Sprint and add these issues to it
* configure the board to use Story Points for estimation
* enable Remaining Estimate and Time Spent for estimation
* estimate the issues and start the Sprint
* now that the sprint is Active, add a sub-task to one of the issues
* go to Burndown Chart, this sub-task is displayed as a scope change
* now disable Remaining Estimate and Time Spent
* go to Burndown Chart, sub-task is not displayed any more

h4. +Suggestion+
This is not a bug:
* the Burndown Chart are to be designed to work that way (toggling sub-task display) depending on whether Remaining Estimate and Time Spent is enabled or not
** Time estimates are rolled-up from sub-tasks to the parent task.
* the fact that sub-tasks are treated as scope change, if created in an Active sprint, sounds logical

However, these behaviors do not seem to be documented anywhere in JIRA Agile documentation, including:
* [Estimating an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Estimating+an+Issue]
* [Configuring Estimation and Tracking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking]
* [Tutorial - Planning and Estimating work for an Agile team|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Tutorial+-+Planning+and+Estimating+work+for+an+Agile+team]
fields.summary: Sub-tasks added to Active sprints are considered Scope Change if Remaining Estimate and Time Spent is enabled

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
When Swimlanes are based on Epics and there are Issues linked to Epics which are not available in the board, then these Issues are still visible in Backlog (for Scrum) & Kanban Backlog (Kanban) but invisible in Active Sprints (both Scrum and Kanban)

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Create board A (Scrum) for project A, which should filter all issues in project A
# Create project B, then create Epic B in project B
# Create Issue A in project A, then link it to Epic B
# Create a sprint in board A, add Issue A to it and start it
# Configure board A and base Swimlanes on Epics

h4. +Expected behavior+
Issue A is visible in Active Sprints of board A

h4. +Actual behavior+
Issue A is invisible in Active Sprints of board A

(i) If Issue Count is enabled for the Columns, we can see a mismatch in the number of issues like this:
!activesprint.png|thumbnail!

In Backlog mode, all the 4 issues are visible:
!backlog.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
(!) The same behavior applies to both Scrum and Kanban boards

h4. +Original Description+
{panel}
We have put some stories in our sprint that are connected to epics from an "Epics" project, which contains Epics that span multiple projects. 

The Saved Filter for the board is the default:
project = "This Project" ORDER BY Rank ASC

In "plan" mode I can see the tasks
In "work" mode when we select "swimlanes by epic" these stories disappear. They also do not show under "issues without epics". 

The workaround suggested elsewhere is to change the Saved Filter to:
project = "This Project" OR ( project = Epics AND type = epic ) ORDER BY Rank ASC

However, this then means that when you go to "plan" mode and show the Epics panel, you then see all multi-project Epics, even if they do not have any tasks in the current project.
{panel}
fields.summary: Stories from external epics disappear in swimlanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA, the [estimate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue#LoggingWorkonanIssue-originalestimateSpecifyingtimeestimates] term means the time estimates on an issue. 

In JIRA Agile, the term [estimate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking] means a measure of the size/complexity of the task. The same term used differently in different contexts is confusing for the customers. 


We need to pick different terms for JIRA and JIRA Agile so that customers don't get confused with these terms.
fields.summary: Term "Estimation" means different things in JIRA and Agile world

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After upgrade to JIRA Agile 6.6 we are experiencing different behavior than it was before, regarding Issue Detail View shown on Agile Board View.

Is it possible to turn-off the behavior that a single click on an issue on the JIRA agile board opens the quick info (issue detail view) for that issue on the right side? In the past you first had to navigate to an issue with a click then press 'T' to open / close the quick info. 

We find this new behavior quite irritating!

At least we expect to have option to turn it off-on.
fields.summary: Issue Detail View - turn off the new behavior to display issue details automatically

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to [JRA-5225], subtasks do not inherit Fix Versions of parents when Fix Versions are updated, and vice-versa. Because of this, sometimes parents have Fix Versions but subtasks do not (created without Fix Versions). This causes confusion to users who work on subtasks, and there's a chance that they will update subtasks with Fix Versions which do not follow parents'.

Suggestion is to be able to easily hide subtasks' Fix Versions in Agile boards. Currently this can be done by using Field Configurations, but once the field is hidden, subtasks no longer appear in Kanban boards as the default Work Sub-filter will filter them out - Hidden is not treated as Empty.

The only feasible workaround is to manually adjust the Work Sub-filter to include subtasks.
fields.summary: Hide subtasks' Fix Versions without interfering with Work Sub-filter

fields.description:
When we delete a custom field that was added in the card layout of a given board, that board end up inaccessible with the following error:
{quote}
ERROR:
The field with id 'customfield_10024' is not a NavigableField.
{quote}

!card_layout.png!
!board_inaccessible.png!

*WORKAROUND*: Create a copy of the board, as the card layout information is not carried over to the copy, so the message will no longer be displayed.
fields.summary: Deleting a custom field that is present in the card layout of a given board makes the board no longer accessible

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to show the User Story's remaining hours as a summation of the subtasks remaining hours on the scrum board so I can quickly see at a glance the remaining hours for a story.

Currently, I cannot see the remaining hours of a User Story as I can when viewing the ticket.  We would like to see this on the scrum board,

I tried to use the 'Customizing Cards' area when configuring my board, but when I add 'Remaining Hours' field to a card, it shows 'none' on the parent ticket instead of a summary.

Acceptance Criteria:
I can see the summation of all subtasks' remaining hours on the User Story on the scrum board.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to show the User Story's remaining hours as a summation of the subtasks remaining hours on the scrum board so I can quickly see at a glance the remaining hours for a story.

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Configure the Board to use *Remaining Estimate and Time Spent* estimation.
# Go to Plan mode and add a new sprint.
# Add two issues such as DEMO-4 and DEMO-5:
#* DEMO-4 contain no sub-task.
#* DEMO-5 got one sub-task.
# Assign 12m to *Remaining Estimate* for DEMO-5 by clicking the *down arrow*:
!demo-5.png|thumbnail!
# Next, assign 20m to *Remaining Estimate* for DEMO-4, then bump into the Javascripts error because the pop up box doesn't closed and the value still refer back to DEMO-5:
!demo-4.png|thumbnail!
!JS-error.png|thumbnail!

h4.Expected Behavior:

After assign *Remaining Estimate* value to the issue that contain sub-task, the next issue should not show the pop up box again.
fields.summary: Get Javascript error after edit Remaining value in Plan mode
